title: Australian Idol star Shannon Noll's heartwarming gesture revealed in sweet letter
text:
A dog owner has issued a heartfelt thank you to Australian Idol star Shannon Noll, ten years after the singer saved his pooch from being killed.

The Queensland man, identified only as Koovy, reached out to Nollsie when he returned to the region for the Borderline music festival in Goondiwindi on Saturday.

Sharing a picture of the note on Instagram, the 44-year-old singer said: 'A little bit of kindness can mean the world to people.'

What a gent! A dog owner has issued a heartfelt thank you to Australian Idol star Shannon Noll (pictured)

From the letter, it appears the man was selling a painting to raise money to save his dog when Shannon stepped in.

The dog owner wrote: 'I did not get an opportunity to thank you for the purchase of my painting about 10 years ago to save my dog from euthanasia while he was in the pound.

'I did not realise it was you and I thank you for your kindness in saving my dog.'

How sweet! It appears the man was selling a painting to raise money to save his dog when Shannon stepped in

Shannon explained that he made the purchase a decade ago while visiting St George in Queensland with friends.

But he was only reminded of the long-forgotten gesture when he received the hand-written note.

'I got this letter passed on to me whilst I was in Goondiwindi on the weekend,' he wrote on Instagram.

Good deed! 'I got this letter passed on to me whilst I was in Goondiwindi on the weekend,' he wrote on Instagram

'It made me feel really good and I suppose it just goes to show a little bit of kindness can mean the world to people!'

Earlier this week, Shannon revealed he is getting set to launch a new single.

He took to Instagram on Saturday to announce his new tune, Long Live the Summer.

In a short video posted to the social media site, the singer revealed that the single is now available for pre-order.
description: Australian Idol star Shannon Noll (pictured) received a sweet note after he saved a dog from the pound.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
